\vspace{4pt}
\begin{center}
\begingroup
\fontfamily{ppl}\fontsize{18}{20}\selectfont
Professional Summary
\endgroup
\end{center}

Machine learning and AI researcher specializing in geospatial and computer vision applications for agriculture and environmental systems. Experience developing predictive models using remote sensing and multimodal data to improve decision-making in plant health, invasive species management, and agricultural risk forecasting. Experience leading interdisciplinary research, securing competitive funding, and translating research into applications.

Academic Appointments
\endgroup

\vspace{4pt}

**Postdoctoral Research Scholar**, Center for Geospatial Analytics, North Carolina State University \hfill 2023–present  
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developed and lead research on AI-enabled surveillance systems for agricultural risk  
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;forecasting and invasive species monitoring. Supervised graduate and undergraduate researchers,  
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;and collaborated with teams across ecology, computer science, and plant sciences.

**Graduate Research Assistant**, Department of Plant & Microbial Biology, University of Minnesota \hfill 2018–2023  
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developed predictive models of invasive species spread using genomic, climatic, and satellite data.  
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Applied models to improve ecological forecasting under climate change scenarios.  

**Researcher I**, USDA Agricultural Research Service (ARS), Cereal Disease Laboratory, St. Paul, MN \hfill 2017–2018  
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conducted applied research in plant pathology for disease gene discovery.  
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Collaborated with federal scientists on agricultural biosecurity and crop health research.
